text:
For those who are not based in the UK, this is apparently what UK customers get to choose: <https://250e322s2k5xhp2r2sza0bo6-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/My-Betfair-Rewards-Available-Packages-Desktop.png> which basically means they get to pay 2% commission instead of the higher rate we pay.
Seems arbitrary and unfair. I asked customer service about it through the chat and they basically said FU this is for UK persons only. I wonder if there is anything I could do about this?

elements.text: For those who are not based in the UK, this is apparently what UK customers get to choose:

which basically means they get to pay 2% commission instead of the higher rate we pay.
Seems arbitrary and unfair. I asked customer service about it through the chat and they basically said FU this is for UK persons only. I wonder if there is anything I could do about this?

elements.text: Yep - 2% commission as opposed to 5% for most sports seems a bit of a no-brainer to me, if it were offered

text: Quick question - I'm slowly getting to grips with Betfairlightweight, and figuring out how to use Flumine, and looking at the BaseStrategy class, does this work on one market book at a time? e.g. process_market_book(self,market,market_book) - would I have to overwrite the BaseStrategy class if I wanted to get it working with two separate markets as an input ?

elements.text: Quick question - I'm slowly getting to grips with Betfairlightweight, and figuring out how to use Flumine, and looking at the BaseStrategy class, does this work on one market book at a time? e.g. process_market_book(self,market,market_book) - would I have to overwrite the BaseStrategy class if I wanted to get it working with two separate markets as an input ?

text:
so its event driven, processing one market at a time however if you want to access another market you can:
```# event markets contains a dictionary of all event related markets
event_markets = market.event

# all markets (need to create a property for this)
all_markets = self.flumine.markets  # <flumine.markets.Markets> object```

elements.text: so its event driven, processing one market at a time however if you want to access another market you can:

# event markets contains a dictionary of all event related markets
event_markets = market.event

# all markets (need to create a property for this)
all_markets = self.flumine.markets  # <flumine.markets.Markets> object
